page.title: 10NEWTON HALL WILDLIFE (3)
page.content: In the stream at the old sand quarry there are Stickleback and Minnows, Smooth and Crested Newts,Frogs and Toads.Brasside,which consists of three large ponds,attracts a variety of wildlife- Swans,Canada and Brent Geese,Cot,MoorHen,Little and Great Crested Grebe,Mallard,Tufted Duck and Heron.In winter these are increased with Goosander,Merganser,Pochard Cormorant,Blackheaded and Heron Gulls. A variety of marsh birds like Yellow Bunting,Reed Bunting,Grey and Yellow Ragtail and Sedgewarbler can be seen. In the surrounding woods Woodcock, Partridge,Pheasant,Jay,Green and Greater Spotted Woodpecker,Long Tail Tit,Tree Creeper,Tawney and Long Eared Owl,Kestrel and Sparrow Hawk are evident.There is a variety of insects - Dragon Fly,Butterflies(Red Admiral), Garden Tiger Moths have been spotted.
